review_title: Probably the best promotion I've had.

review_content: I am very new to the whole music promotion game , but after researching quite a few companies , this was one of the only legit , non bot driven , play listing promotional campaigns that won't cause artists any pain and misery with their songs on DSPs and with distribution. Im a newly signed artist with HRDRV and I want everything done by the book. No streams coming from via bots , no fake playlists driven by bots , only organic paid for promotion , like the major labels use to even out the playing field. I have great confidence in myself as an artist , and I pride myself on a consistent , hardworking , moral ethical code , especially with sharing my music with the world , as I am very authentic. This is one of the only companies in my new experience that organically does everything by the book , so artists won't get strikes , and have issues with their catalogues. The playlists they pitch to provide steady numbers that are real , and results may very due to a great number of things , but they are real results you can feel good about , instead of constantly worrying if this promotion is ethical and truly adheres to the DSPs rules. This is my 1st month attempting any promo at all , as I have only been signed and releasing music consistently for 6 months to the day. I have thus far been happy with my few experiences with this company. I tried a total of 3 different companies and was NOT at all happy with the other 2 and immediately requested they stop promo and refund my hard earned money and threatened legal action , as I own the music. I was not paid for my opinion , its actual and factual. I want solid growth , and an organically promoted system in place , that drives actual fans to my music. I am NOT ONLY CONCERNED WITH NUMBERS LIKE MOST. Fake numbers don't matter , if the fanbase isn't organically growing , and that's facts. This service costs more that the others , but I believe you get what you pay for TBH. I am thus far happy with the slow and steady real results , instead of the fast , fake , headaches from the other 2 promo companies . Just because promo companies advertise on Facebook and Instagram doesn't mean they are legit , research and reads actual artists experiences , please for your own sake. God bless you all and the real organic promotional companies , and I wish and pray all the others to receive the karma they deserve for the stress and dishonesty they promote and cause.Sincerely ,Natethoven
Theyre the truth

Working with Boost Collective has turned out to be a total disaster! A first campaign was Bronze, estimated results 500 to 1.500. Well, the campaign yielded no more than 37 streams in total! Quite disappointing, even so as emails to report the shortcoming remained unanswered. Being good-natured and somewhat naive, I thought let's grant them a second chance, this time with a Gold+Upgrade campaign, and maybe then results will be more appropriate. Even worse! The Gold+Upgrade yielded only 11 streams in total! With estimated results between 2k and 5k, this cannot be called a fair deal! This time, a first email to report the malfunctioning was answered with highly encouraging promises: "Your success is my priority, and I'm on it to make things right ... and get those numbers climbing". However, the next few weeks there was still no improvement at all. From then on, all emails were again left unanswered. Then I claimed a refund, as obviously the goods had not been delivered. Again no response. Oh, and have I mentioned that the '+Upgrade' includes "priority support"? Shame on them!
Thrilled with the service! My music is strategically placed, reaching my audience exactly where I needed it to be. Excellent job

review_title: Would Recommend! But Slow To Respond
review_content: I've run a couple of the bronze tier campaigns through Boost Collective and they delivered on what they had promised. I'm super afraid of someone farming my streams and sending me to algorithm purgatory, so I was pleased to see the new audience I saw from Boost Collective all looked like real people. However, they were very slow to respond when I had a billing issue - they didn't respond to my email for almost five months.Overall, would recommend for starting artists looking to boost their algorithm after a release ‚Äì just don't expect a prompt reply if you have a problem! <3

Follow up to initial Bronze promo which was ok.Upgrade order (order 9146)Also tried a gold promo (8 playlists pitching) and an upgrade.orders 12482/12687.Track was added to 8 playlists.Which turned out to be very inactive.So reached out to try and get the problem resolved.The main issue was the amount of time and lack of response to a number of emails.I understand they are very busy.However it was frustrating receiving promotional emails advising me to start more campaigns but no response to the emails.I eventually had a reply advising they could offer a credit note and a new campaign which sounded good.As I wasn't convinced I asked for a refund.Total amount was $150.15Then arranged to try credit note and different tracks which sounded fine.I did however after writing this review receive a response offering a free change of playlists to more active ones. And also a refund for the campaign.So waiting on the refund.

review_title: Stay away - they'll take your money and run
review_content: Complete and total waste of time and money. 16 streams in 2 months(!) is all they've offered, but what is really annoying is the complete lack of communication or personalized attention to my submission for the entire 8 weeks. It's obvious that they haven't been "continuously monitoring the performance" or "made any required adjustments to ensure my music gets the attention it deserves" (as their website states), since the song was included in only 3 playlists (in very low positions as well) and nothing ever changed since that initial placement. What is more, the playlists are actually curated by themselves, so it wasn't even that they had to pitch the song to a curator or anything like that, which could justify the cost of the service.As the campaign completely failed to meet the expectations advertised, I felt I was perfectly entitled to request a refund, but I haven't heard anything in over 2 weeks now. Even if they answer, they will say that as per their terms and conditions, they can't guarantee a specific number of streams, just a number of playlist placements - but even so, 3 playlists is not what the advertisement said.  If they felt the track was not a good match for their playlists, the decent thing to do would be to tell the customer straight away rather than take the money and run. Overall, a truly awful experience: complete lack of transparency, non-existent communication and, obviously, no results. Don't bother submitting your music to them and if they keep bombarding you with Facebook ads or emails, just ignore them - or even better, block and report them.
haven't seen any progress just yet, but I've heard good things. excited to see where this leads.
Highly recommended! We've worked with Boost Collective for 2 of our previous releases and were very satisfied both times.

review_title: Don't use them they are poor quality
review_content: Don't use them they are poor qualitySo disappointing. I spent $350 on their playlist package which promises a minimum of 15,000 streams. It's been one month since my release and their service has only provided 500 steams on my song so far. The playlists they pitch to are very low quality and not worth the cost. I have used other playlist pitching companies where I have been able to get 20,000 organic streams in one month. So don't waste your money on these guys. They are just trying to make a quick profit off of you. I already know they can't "guarantee" streams... but then don't offer a service if your cannot deliver results.

I really like the ease of signing up and the projected plays definitely helped me select a package and manage what to expect. I find value in promoting my music, and getting my songs heard is worth every penny. I wouldn't start a business without advertising, and to me this is no different. As a new artist, getting on playlists, being added to my listeners' likes and subsequently added to additional playlists is helping me grow, where before getting any streams at all was difficult. My previous campaign was with Omari MC and that was a great experience as well, but he does only promote clean music - so many of my collabs/remixes wouldn't be an option to promote. This is when I looked to Boost Collective to make sure I can promote my remixes and collaborations. Their promotional deals are also well worth it. I look forward to seeing my campaign results with Boost Collective. Nothing feels better than seeing people listening!

I decided to try the promotion service after doing some research to ascertain that I would not promote my song to bots.Once the decision was made it was easy to choose which song to promote and fairly easy to go through with the purchase.One hick-up with payment was that I could not pay with my Visa card for some reason. review_content: They‚Äôre always super helpful and reply as quick as they can if you ever need help and they actually help you grow. Patience is key though.

Absolutely Horrible. Would not recommend.Do not reply to emails.Bought the package for 24 hour priority placements - did not get priority placements. So far the stream count has only  gone up, my streams only went up from other playlists. Also it seems the playlists I am being added to are all from the same user "unpause". Upon digging deeper, I found that this is a Boost Collective employee, and not a curator outside of their company. Basically they are overcharging you for playlists that they own themselves, and not pitching to relevant curators.Also, none of the playlists match my genre, despite me emailing them in advance with some information about the type of playlists I want to get listed in. But, you guessed it, they did not reply to my email with this description.tl;dr:NO customer service, NO "reaching the right fans", NO reaching the correct curators for your music. Avoid at all costs. Will settle this with PayPal and get my money back from these scammers.

review_content: I have booked the campaign for my song + the upgrade. I should be pitched into twice as many playlists as a result. But I'm only in 3 playlists. After my first complaint, I received an email  that I should be in 3 more, but the covers of the playlists were not visible and I didn't see any real effects of playlists on Spotify either. I'm also totally dissatisfied in general. I'm somewhere in the middle of the playlists and generate exactly 0 streams from the 120 euros I've invested. I find the service very poor at the moment. I feel that due to Black friday special, they have big capacity problems.
